content:
While following up on #feedback > FR - Organization Notification Enforcement , I noticed that I'd apparently set my desktop app to Do Not Disturb a while ago, and forgotten all about it. Thoughts on how to make it more obvious? The only indication currently is the slash through the icon and the tooltip you see when you hover.

Screen-Shot-2023-01-24-at-1.24.45-PM.png
Also, should we switch that icon to a speaker, like we did elsewhere in the app?
Well, we made speaker be "mute"; it's not clear "do not disturb" should have the same icon.

I don't know how other apps tend to represent that idea, but I certainly agree that icon change is pretty subtle. Possibly something involving a highlighted outline around that element would be a good approach to make it feel like there's an unusual state enabled.
